casebody.data:
Bernard J. Ludwig et al., Respondents, v. Rolland E. Gove, Appellant. (City Court of New York

General Term,

October, 1895.) An appeal will not lie fromT'an order sustaining a demurrer, to an answer with leave to amend. Appeal from order sustaining demurrer to answer,, with leave to amend. *234Fellowes & Wright, for appellant. ■ Wager & Acker, for respondents. Fitzsimons, J.

The plaintiffs demurred to the defendant’s answer. The demurrer, was sustained, with leave to the defendant to amend his answer. An order to that effect was-entered. From such order this appeal is taken. .

The appeal must he dismissed because, from the order entered herein, no appeal lies. Denslow v. Bush, 9 Misc. Rep. 337.

Appeal dismissed, with costs.

Yan 'Wyck, Oh. J.,. concurs. .

Appeal dismissed, with costs.
